entry.title: Poincaré series of modules over compressed Gorenstein local rings
entry.summary: Given positive integers e and s we consider Gorenstein Artinian local rings R of embedding dimension e whose maximal ideal $\fm$ satisfies $\fm^s\ne 0=\fm^{s+1}$. We say that R is a compressed Gorenstein local ring when it has maximal length among such rings. It is known that generic Gorenstein Artinian algebras are compressed. If $s\ne 3$, we prove that the Poincare series of all finitely generated modules over a compressed Gorenstein local ring are rational, sharing a common denominator. A formula for the denominator is given. When s is even this formula depends only on the integers e and s. Note that for s=3 examples of compressed Gorenstein local rings with transcendental Poincare series exist, due to Bogvad.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a major rewriting of the earlier version. The results have been extended to treat the odd socle degree case at the same time with the even socle degree case. Also, the "generic Gorenstein algebra" hypothesis in the earlier version has been extended to "compressed Gorenstein local ring"
